author: Traditionalcanbegood
title: NHS staff attitude
body:
I had to take my wife to Aberdeen NHS Accident & Emergency department and arrived at about 12.50pm. After 3 hours of waiting I spoke to the reception staff asking about how long we may be expected to wait. The young staff member was cheery and said my Wife was next to be seen. I was pleased to hear this, commenting that it was a bit frustrating to see other patients arrive in A&E then be called to be seen by Doctor moments later and we had been waiting three hours.  
It was then that another staff member in this reception jumped into the conversation, commenting that this was because these patients had called the 111 helpline and made an appointment to be seen by a Doctor and this service was common knowledge and had been widely promoted in the press for the past three years. I was a taken back by this personal verbal assault and told them that I may seem old fashioned but the sign above the door said Accident and Emergency and that my first thought was not to call a NHS helpline to hear what I already knew, that my Wife needed medical help fast.  
This didn‚Äôt seem to phase them at all and I thanked the first staff member for their help and left. In this department there were constant announcements over the speakers that verbal abuse of any kind is not tolerated towards NHS staff (as it should be), yet there should be a notice that this works both ways. I am sure some may say the NHS are overworked and understaffed, but the attitude by this person was rude and vulgar, everything you don‚Äôt need in a time when stress levels are high to start with and stemming not from a complaint but a simple observation. Their comments were unnecessary, as was the smug attitude and I feel that this person should go on some patient empathy training, and after all that to find my Wife had been waiting three hours with a broken knee.  
The story does have a positive ending and shows the polar differences in staff and their attitudes, as the Doctor who helped my Wife was so thoughtful and thorough in their diagnosis and care, someone who the reception person could take a lesson from.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: MrsBura
title: Such an invaluable resource
body:
We were really struggling with our baby who was refusing all solid food, it was very distressing to watch him become so emotional over us trying to encourage him to eat, we were deflated and upset at why he wasn't progressing with his eating.  
Our health visitor referred us to the early years workers, and we met with Pauline. She came to observe our baby and offered practical tips to implement, and explained how we could help. With persistence and perseverance our little one has cut down his milk intake by over half and is now starting to eat a variety of foods.  
At our last visit I also mentioned some other concerns to Pauline which were outside of the reasons for her visit, but again, she directed us to resources that could help us, and also escalated our concerns officially to our health visitor for follow up.  
Our experience with the early years workers has been nothing but positive, and we have really found them such an invaluable resource. Thank you!

author: Bonnie 14
title: Waiting for an assessment
body:
My son was diagnosed with ADHD and dyslexia when he was at school. He was prescribed meds to help him cope with his lack of concentration and his inability to recall information. He was encouraged to try to cope without the meds in adulthood.  
Unfortunately he is unable to cope with what is expected of him in the daily life of employment and he's always let go in the numerous jobs he's tried. He has been offered the help of supported employment, but it's been suggested being back on meds again would benefit his chance of success.  
After being referred to East Ayrshire community mental health team, we have been told he won't be seen for 7 or 8 months to be assessed to restart meds that previously helped him cope.  
I find this unacceptable that he has to wait 7 to 8 months for an assessment and potentially a prescription for medication to help him move forward and cope with employment.  
No diagnosis is needed here, this is why this wait is unacceptable and unfair.

readBy.name: East Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

author: Lrtx
title: Helpful and professional
body:
After talking to Kym on the phone about my medication it put me at ease, and Luke and Beth at the clinic were very helpful and professional. Especially after feeling a bit faint from my blood being taken, Luke was very calming and did everything to make sure I was OK.  
Thank you

author: rushes999
title: Their professional care was just amazing
body: My dad was seen in ED in SWAH very quickly due to an emergency. The staff in particular Dr Lillis, Dr Ben, SN Claire & SN Emma were exceptional & totally professional in looking after him while there. Dr Ben explained everything to myself & my dad what was happening, even though he was in a lot of pain, he was able to comprehend what was going. Their professional care of my dad was just amazing, & myself & my dad wish to thank them very much for this. Thankfully he was discharged from ED with a plan in place.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Allie272
title: Very helpful staff
body:
I had a fantastic experience whilst giving birth to our baby daughter. All the staff couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful and their friendly approach made my time in hospital such a pleasure.  
During delivery Charlene the midwife was excellent. She was so calm and made me feel so relaxed throughout. Her professionalism was exceptional.  
All the staff on maternity ward couldn‚Äôt do enough for us and nothing has been any hassle at all. Very helpful staff.  
I also have really enjoyed all the friendly chats with all the staff- they mean a lot and also the advice has been greatly appreciated.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jen24
title: Excellent friendly, speedy service
body:
Attended the paediatric emergency department this morning as my son had hurt his leg. Excellent friendly, speedy service from the receptionist, to the triage nurse, to the doctor, to the radiographer.  
Thom, the doctor, was really good with my teenage son. Great interaction & explanations. Very reassuring & helpful advice.  
Great service all round

author: MariB
title: The compassion and care of the staff was immense
body:
My mum was rushed from Ayrshire to Hairmyers Coronary Care Unit. The drs were waiting for her and she was on the table within 5 minutes of arrival. The staff looked after my sister and myself.  
The love, care and support given to my mum was beyond words, you couldn't get better care if you paid for it.  
Thanks just wasn't enough, the whole team were fantastic and the care was second to none.  
Unfortunately my mum died a few days later but again the compassion and care of the staff was immense.  
As a family we are sending our heartfelt thanks to each one of you.

readBy.name: Office of Ruth Maguire ( Mp for Cunninghame South )

title: Poor
body:
I was with the york CMHT until moving to tadcaster last year they were great and supported me, I‚Äôm now with the selby CMHT I find them really unhelpful 
They never get back to you when they say I‚Äôve been waiting for a medication review since last November as my current medication is not helping my diagnosis 
I‚Äôve phoned on numerous times to speak the the duty worker as I get horrendous suicidal thoughts they just don‚Äôt call you back 
I‚Äôm supposed to be getting a letter to see the psychiatrist but it never arrived 
So really not helpful this team

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

author: snowxg75
title: I had a great experience
body: I had a great experience. My baby and husband came in to the appointment too in case the baby needed me and the nurse was lovely, laid back and explained everything really well. She was chatty and kept everyone relaxed. Any question I asked was no bother for her to answer and it was just a great all round experience. Well done and thank you.

author: Sarah1983
title: The service was just amazing and efficient
body:
I‚Äôd like to commend the SWAH and Dr Podmore‚Äôs clinic for running so efficiently.  
I was there with my mam and my son for my Mam's appointment. I checked Mam in on the scanner and walked down to Outpatients 2.  
We were met by a staff member who called Mam by name. I stayed out with my son and wondered how long we would be and how I would entertain him. He had a drink of water, which was available to us from the font, and watched the working screen a few minutes, and then we were going to the toilet when Mam came out again.  
It was so efficient and prompt and we felt the service was just amazing and efficient. Mam got great news, which is always uplifting to hear as well üëèüèº  
Thanks to the SWAH team üíï‚ú®

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Salky
title: Misinformed during a medical procedure
body:
After a long period of heavy bleeding I was referred to women‚Äôs hospital for a hysteroscopy, due to a long waiting list my issues had gone away properly as I‚Äôve come into the menopause.  
I had an appointment with doctor before gynaecologist, who never explained anything about pain levels. I asked questions & I asked was it as painful as a colposcopy which I had 8 years ago and was painful! Was informed no pain as Local Anaesthetic (LA) will be given and mild painkillers is all you need.  
I asked about sedation and was told I don‚Äôt need it and it‚Äôs not something they do, asked about gas & air was told yes üôå can have this, at this point I was informed about General Anaesthetic (GA) but after doctor explained that it‚Äôs not painful and managed with paracetamol I was made to feel foolish, asking for LA and happy with what I was told - mild pain.  
Explained past history and previous Gynaecologist suggested always spray with LA Anaesthetic first with gas & air, reassured wouldn‚Äôt need it but was there if I felt I wanted it.  
On the day explained all my history and asked for gas & air, explained my back injury. Informed what was discussed with Gynae doctor & 8 years ago what was suggested. Doctor reassured me no pain or mild, they said yes you can have gas & air no problem.  
But during the hysteroscopy I was refused gas & air by the doctor, when shouting out in pain nurse tried to give me gas & air and doctor shout at them that it won‚Äôt make any difference.  
Doctor did not explain what surgical tools they would be using or when they were about to do something (informed me afterwards). Was inappropriate about moving down the bed and made a joke about it. Was inappropriately laughing with nurse about boyfriends, not sure what the joke was but felt uncomfortable and unprofessional.  
No one in the room introduced themselves - didn‚Äôt get anyone's name, was told the doctor's name once in reception.  
Wasn‚Äôt listened to and didn‚Äôt consent to what was happening, being touched without being informed beforehand. Handled roughly when doctors moved me on the bed to give LA and then doctor left the area they were injecting stood over me and said do you want to cancel this. I said I just want pain relief or gas & air. They angrily said give me some (gas & air) also told me they'd given me extra LA.  
Didn‚Äôt ask on a scale of 1-10 where your pain during the process  
Didn‚Äôt ask if I was comfortable with my back issues  
Didn‚Äôt care afterwards that I was in a lot of pain confused and in shock, shaking & high blood pressure  
Nurse on reception told me that I would not be in pain, mild discomfort, and I could have gas & air also she went and got the doctor to come in to reassure me I could have gas & air but this didn‚Äôt happen.  
Nurse informed me any tags or small fibroid would be removed today, never happened.  
Biopsy was taken but no time scale given on results or where to get results - doctor verbally told me you do not have cancer & to be grateful for that, if they informed me I didn‚Äôt have cancer then why do a biopsy.  
Asked why fibroid was not removed as the nurse had suggested , doctor told it‚Äôs like removing a house brick, not that easy. Why was this the medical term for explaining something to me? I understand anatomy and physiology & felt the doctor was being patronising and didn‚Äôt explain anything.  
I was not helped out of the room or checked on while getting off the table, no extra support was given for my back. Despite me asking the nurses in the room, they watched me in distress & pain, one nurse tried their best to help but was told off. I asked two of the nurses why they didn‚Äôt they help, why don‚Äôt they give me gas & air, why did they allow me to suffer? (I was in too much shock to ask the doctor to stop). Nurse didn‚Äôt answer me just looked down and smiled sadly.  
With gas & air and LA I still felt excruciating pain and doctor said no you can‚Äôt have felt it, I gave you extra LA, I know pain and I felt pain.  
I informed the nurse that checked me in that I was denied gas & air and wanted an explanation as to why, as I was confused with what they agreed to 20 mins ago didn‚Äôt happen, they did the opposite. The nurse asked the doctor and in my view the doctor lied with their reason.  
Post op 1x A&E 3 x GP, ongoing trauma and back.  
Pain & stomach issues and time off from work.  
This doctor informed me I could go the gym & back to work the same day, they also advise that 90% of women feel no pain and the rest mild.  
I felt threatened & scared, doctor standing over me looking angry üò°, I feel abused & misinformed  
I‚Äôm not the only person, I have found a support group, I believe there are thousands of women who have the same experience, and it‚Äôs going unreported.

author: piscesmf89
title: I have serious mental health problems but no support
body:
I was sent to Arndale Mental Health Resource Centre, Glasgow initially in November 2021 and was a patient there till August 2022.  
On that appointment a psychiatric nurse came over straight into my face, making me lower my face mask and looking down my throat, insulting me by disbelieving what I said to him and taking advantage of my fragile mental state. He broke the Covid distance rules and entered, without my consent, into my private space, where I felt threatened and intimidated. He was there to do a psychiatric assessment, not abuse me and look down my throat. For a healthcare worker to do these things to a patient is diabolical.  
At that same appointment they did not listen to a word I said, made light of my problems and never took into the consideration the severity of my mental health, where I was extremely suicidal and wanted to kill myself. They asked irrelevant questions, were rude to me with judgemental outbursts, and did not allow me to talk in full about what I wanted to say.  
They also left me, a very suicidal person, to leave the premises without any contact details about anyone or anywhere, in case I needed to contact someone if I needed mental health support. They said I had Asperger‚Äôs syndrome, even though only ASD professionals can diagnose that.  
When I finally got to speak to a psychiatrist, they phoned me fifteen minutes late and took only twenty minutes of what was meant to be an hour-long telephone consultation. I felt they did not take into account the fragile state of my mental health and my willingness to commit suicide. They did not provide the medication required nor strongly state the need for me to be on anti-depressants. I felt the psychiatrist did absolutely nothing to help me.  
In a year of dealing with them, I only got one 20-minute phone call and one half-hour webcam appointment. I felt they did not listen to a word I said, did not take into consideration the seriousness of my mental health and did not diagnose me with the problems I clearly have. I believe the professional I spoke to broke my confidentiality by putting our conversation on the NHS staff website. I have seen the records now and they are a distortion of what I said. I believe my problems were totally ignored, and I did not feel any empathy for the horrors I have endured in life. I need serious mental health support, but they did not provide this, did not help or diagnose my problems.  
I have all the symptoms of schizophrenia and anyone can see that, but not them. I have no diagnosis and no treatment for this condition. I am left to suffer alone.  
Then without my knowledge or consent I was removed from Arndale services and despite my doctor and myself trying to find another mental health service, I have been unable to get any necessary treatment or support for what is now over seven months because Arndale and HSCP are refusing to allow me to attend another mental health service anywhere in Glasgow or East Dunbartonshire. I therefore have been left to suffer with all my mental health problems for over seven months now without a proper diagnosis, support, treatment or any help whatsoever.  
I have serious problems with my mental health and right now I have no mental health support whatsoever, from anyone or anywhere. They have all failed me for now what is over a year. I am left to suffer alone with what is probably schizophrenia, and I am left alone to suffer because of Arndale.  
I have tried to kill myself on many occasions. I feel that trying to access care has made me a lot worse mentally than I was before.

author: Rebecca20
title: Overall a very positive experience
body:
This was my second baby - But my first experience at Preston Sharoe Green and I just wanted to say Thank you - As I know this is something that is often not said.  
I had my first baby at a different hospital and I found the whole experience very traumatic and this resulted in my having postnatal depression and Anxiety. When I found out we were expecting our second I was worried about my mental health.The care I have received from Preston has been wonderful - From supporting me with my Hyperemesis,keeping a close eye on baby growth and health, giving me strep B treatment for labour and just generally being kind and listening to me.  
In particular I would like to thank the induction ward - Sharon & Kathryn (Student midwife), who listened to me and reassured me when I was scared and feeling overwhelmed by needing to be induced again, given my bad experience with my first baby.  
Vicky was lovely on the night shifts and Tracy and Janet who were with me when things ramped up on the night shift were brilliant and listened to me promptly when I said baby was coming and provided me with Gas and Air as it seems my babies like to act like nothing is happening and then suddenly decide it is time for their Birthday! (I never got my water birth but we had a safe arrival so thank you.)  
I wasn't up on Labour ward very long but again I felt listened to and not rushed and my little girl was checked over well in antenatal ward so we were not sent home until we knew baby was well!  
Overall a very positive experience - SO Thank you Preston - I know you are incredibly busy but the care was wonderful and I know it is only 3 weeks since my baby arrived, but curently my mental health is so much better and I am smiling and have bonded really well - Thank You.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: caelumdg33
title: Still waiting for an appointment
body:
My child has had GI problems and has been under general paediatrics. There‚Äôve been a few referrals to other departments, but the advice for the GI issues - after antihistamines, low dose PPI and otc meds didn‚Äôt help - was to try a high dose PPI for around three months as this is what the gastroenterology department would do as a first treatment option given my child‚Äôs symptoms. If there was no improvement my child would then be referred to gastroenterology and would be seen quicker by them as there‚Äôs already been a first round of treatment.  
My child took the high dose PPI; GI symptoms got slightly worse during that time. A referral to gastroenterology was finally made.  
My child‚Äôs GI problems got worse after the referral was made and the general paediatrics consultant has been in touch by email and phone with a gastroenterology consultant on a number of occasions about the new symptoms and about getting an appointment for my child as the doctor was surprised that my child hadn‚Äôt been appointed yet.  
The general paediatric consultant has now left and I was advised to check with the gastroenterology department myself about an appointment (NHS appointment letters have been lost in the post before so I usually phone appointment booking or the departments directly if I‚Äôm waiting on appointments).  
When I phoned gastroenterology earlier this week, I was told the waiting list for routine appointments is 30+ weeks, and if the symptoms have changed/worsened since the original referral then my child would need a new referral. This was all news to me!!! At no point was this ever mentioned to me before!  
I explained a couple of times that the gastroenterology consultant knows about my child, but the secretary said that they emailed this consultant and the consultant told them that a new referral is needed. The secretary also told me that they can‚Äôt discuss any medical/clinical issues with me. I would have to go back to the GP (who hasn't been involved in my child's care since June 22) or general paediatrics.  
I‚Äôm very upset about the lack of care and misinformation given by the gastroenterology department.  
My child‚Äôs new general paediatrics consultant has kindly given me a phone appointment next week to discuss the gastro issues/referral.  
In the meantime, my child is suffering from bad GI issues every single day and night‚Ä¶

author: Ail28
title: This is an excellent service
body:
Today I attended for removal and reinsertion of a Mirena coil and I would like to call out the staff for their excellent care.  
I was welcomed and taken to the treatment room by a professional nurse, had a consultation where I was listened to and offered advice.  
The actual treatment itself was carried out by Dr Willocks and was over very quickly and pain free. Her knowledge and compassion was excellent and certainly puts you at ease.  
At all times I felt that I was treated with dignity and respect. This is an excellent service and the staff are a credit to the NHS.

author: octoberhm47
title: Very frustrated about appointment booking
body: i have been trying to call to make an appointment as my implant is now overdue and needs to be removed, but every time I call I am on the phone for 25 minutes in a queue and then I get disconnected.Very annoyed, very frustrated and starting to feel stressed and anxious as my GP will not help also.

author: Mum251
title: Fantastic labour experience well beyond anything I expected.
body:
After a rapid labour with my first child, I was hoping that the best case scenario for my second baby would be a stressful and chaotic but ultimately safe experience.  
On the night we rushed to hospital, the labour and delivery team were extremely busy, having just finished managing an emergency situation at the point we arrived.  
In spite of this, the standard of care we received was excellent from start to finish and allowed me to have a fantastic labour experience well beyond anything I expected.  
I was initially met by Georgia at maternity assessment. She had a kind and reassuring manner which instantly put me at ease, and this is something I really valued as a someone who had struggled with anxiety throughout my pregnancy.  
Hannah was the midwife in charge of our care in the delivery room along with student, Rebecca. Due to my expectation of a rapid labour, I hadn't written a birth plan and hadn't given any thought to creating the right environment. I was purely focused on a safe delivery.  
Hannah could have given herself an easier shift after a stressful night by accepting this but instead, she took the time to discuss my choices for pain relief and was able to organise a water birth which I had never imagined would be possible due to the very short timescale we were working with. She even managed to bring a laptop in for us to have some music and this along with her expert guidance throughout the delivery allowed me to feel calm and in control during a very positive birthing experience.  
After my son was born, we continued to receive excellent care from Emma and when we were transferred to the ward, my husband and I commented several times on how fantastic the team were who looked after us and our baby.  
The standard of care from the QEUH maternity team has been consistently high from every midwife, sonographer and doctor I have met in this department throughout my pregnancy despite the challenging work environment and pressures the team are facing each day.  
I am very grateful to everyone who looked after us and played a role in bringing our baby boy into the world!  
Thank you.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Nmf2023
title: You‚Äôre doing such an amazing job and we are lucky to have you
body:
Despite NHS services being totally stretched, we are so lucky to have access to the Sick Kids' Hospital in Edinburgh!!  
I walked into A&E with my 5-week-old baby, who developed difficulty breathing and fever. A&E was packed - I have never seen it so crowded before! We were red flagged and seen quickly and the nurses were so reassuring and productive despite the pressures put on them.  
Thank you to the amazing nurses/Drs who looked after us on Castle Mey Ward- You‚Äôre doing such an amazing job and we are lucky to have you.  
Understandably, no under 5s are allowed on the ward, but there‚Äôs an amazing space in outpatients on the ground floor that I was able to spend time with my 2-year-old whilst dad spent time with baby on the ward.  
We were also introduced to THE HUB, where they offer tea and coffee and there‚Äôs activities /singing etc for the kids and he was even able to choose a book to take home with him.

author: charlesfx23
title: Excellent care in the hospital
body: Respiratory and cardiology units at Forth Valley units are/were excellent in their care for me in last few months.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: papajt35
title: Community Heart Failure Nurse
body: Started using the service after heart failure diagnosed last April - the nurse has been amazing throughout so knowledgeable and helpful with my other concerns and conditions explaining new medication and side effects to look out for

author: siobhancx23
title: Amazingly hard working and caring staff
body:
I was admitted to Ward 18, and the whole nursing staff were fantastic and very caring, but I want to put out a special thank you to nurses Stephanie and Chloe (from ward 18). They both looked after me so well, and spent the time talking with me and helping me feel comfortable. The work they two ladies put in was well above and beyond.  
I also want to put a special thank you to HECT nurse Julie, who was also going above and beyond in her care.  
They work they have is vast, but they still made time for me, to chat when I needed it, to reassure me and my family, and I cannot praise or thank them enough.  
The work that the whole staff put in was outstanding, but especially from they three ladies, the treatment they gave me was like I was their family member.  
Thank you all, so much.

author: Allotment
title: Their expertise and empathy is second to none
body:
I am lost for words on some of the bad reviews - 3 yrs ago I had 3 stents, last year on advice had a CRT-D implanted, and on recent tests it shows a massive difference to my output for the good. Yes, scary times, but Professor Kalra and every person in Cardiology were brilliant, their expertise on heart failure, along with empathy, is second to none.  
I now feel great and do most things as normal.  
Yes, sometimes things go wrong and result in delays, but that's part and parcel of this unit's brilliant service leading to people getting the right intervention, personally I would rather wait or have a delay knowing the outcome may be a good one, it was for me!  
I think people are too quick to damn without knowing the reasons why, and I suspect those (most) went on to enjoy the Cardiologist's expertise as I did, so thank you again to the team.

author: user31
title: Experience in Aberdeen Maternity Hospital
body:
I had my baby boy in Aberdeen Maternity Hospital and was in the Ashgrove Ward after his birth. I ended up having quite a traumatic birth and was in theatre for an emergency forceps delivery.  
I wanted to say a massive thank you to some members of the team that were involved in my care during the labour and recovery.  
First, Senior Charge Midwife Sharon was absolutely lovely to me, my mum and my partner when we were in the labour suite, she was so patient and went out of her way to make me feel more comfortable even though the department was busy. She was so positive and reassuring and took the time to explain everything that was happening.  
Student midwife Jade was incredible with me as well, she was so professional and caring and made me feel so comfortable around her - she will make an amazing midwife.  
I don't remember a lot from theatre but one of the members of staff that has stuck with me since the birth is John from the theatre team. Despite it being a stressful environment for me and my partner, he was by my side the whole time, constantly reassuring me and encouraging me to keep going. I can't thank him enough.  
Healthcare support worker Hannah and student midwife Fiona from the infant breastfeeding team who came to see me after the labour were absolutely incredible. They spent a lot of time with me on the ward when I was struggling with breastfeeding, again just taking the time to explain things to me and reassure me makes such a difference. They were both so lovely, patient and knowledgeable and I am now home and breastfeeding successfully after thinking I wouldn't be able to, all with the help from them.  
Despite it being a scary time for me and my partner and some slight downsides elsewhere in my care, the people I have mentioned above did make the experience more bearable.  
Sorry for the long feedback, I just really hope the positive comments get passed on to those that I've mentioned.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: SEZZYD
title: Having a polypectomy under general anaesthetic
body:
A scan picked up a polyp and I was invited to have a hysteroscopy without anaesthesia. I didn't read up too much about the procedure, just read the leaflet given to me.  
Wow, it proved intolerable painful. They couldn't even get properly through my cervix. They tried twice and then said it wasn't happening and offered me a general anesthetic.  
Within 12 days I was back in hospital in Day Surgery. I had the procedure and it's been relatively painless, no real bleeding and a fine fine team of doctors and nurses cared for me. However it's worth remembering that a GA has a profound affect on the body.  
I felt pretty rough for 3 hours afterwards. I think my salivary glands stopped working and I needed anti-sickness meds. However if you find gynaecological investigations unpleasant and painful you can ask to have it done under GA.  
If you've got a polyp you must have it removed and it's only 18 hours after my op and I feel reasonably good. Huge thanks to Frimley Park hospital in Surrey.

author: romeofm93
title: Sincerest thanks for your time, patience, and expertise
body: I had surgery on my arm and needed the wound dressed and physio afterwards. I'm writing to express my appreciation for the excellent service and caring approach from all the staff involved in my care. Everyone made me feel at ease and helped me in my recovery. My sincerest thanks to the doctors, nurses and physio department for your time, patience, and expertise.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Susan43
title: Helpful service
body: I attended Urogynaecology Clinic K. It was helpful and worthwhile.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Dtb1955
title: Excellent care demonstrated
body:
Very thorough information at the booking stage. Staff at premed today were very good and supportive. Instructions and care prior to procedure were very good and helpful.  
Staff supporting the procedure were excellent. Staff conducting procedure so helpful and comforting, excellent care demonstrated. Staff post procedure very good and supportive. Staff at discharge very good and informative.  
Everything done to make the procedure more pleasant for me as the patient. Very comforting and friendly

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: caringqt65
title: Thank you for my surgical procedure
body:
I feel humbled and delighted about the service rendered by the surgical team. And I am very grateful to the team Patrick, John, Matthew, Nigel the anaesthetic doctor and particularly Dr Findlay although the procedure was cancelled twice but I‚Äôm happy it happened in the end and it was successful.  
I‚Äôm also grateful to the nurses and healthcare assistant particularly Rachel, Vicky (the lady from Belgium) and Tara who made me and my son feel welcomed. Sorry I forgot the names of some of the nurses and health care assistants who were part of my care.  
Although I also met with some nurses and healthcare assistants who in my opinion have gone into a wrong profession, as they were hostile. But I wouldn‚Äôt want to mention names.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Cattolica87
title: Community support was there for me after my brain injury
body:
In November 2021, I suffered a subarachnoid haemorrhage while driving. After arriving at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital, I had to wait 6 hours before being seen by a doctor.  
While in hospital, I was fortunate to be referred to the Community Treatment Centre for Brain Injury by Emily. A few weeks later I had an assessment call with Lorraine, occupational therapist and was referred to Lucie, clinical psychologist.  
I wish to emphasise the vital importance of this service throughout my recovery from my brain bleed. Lucie has aided my rehabilitation by giving me strategies to help my anxiety and low mood. She has always been there for me over the last year and I can't thank her enough for supporting me through a very traumatic time in my life.  
Lorraine and then Laura have helped me to identify my fatigue levels, how to recognise this and manage my fatigue too.  
The Community Treatment Centre is a vital service for people who have suffered a brain injury.

author: TOMMYE
title: Amazing diabetic nurse - can't thank her enough
body:
Having meetings with Kathy the diabetic nurse whom put me at ease straight away as I was staring on insulin injections daily and I was very apprehensive about this.  
Kathy put me at ease form the moment I walked through the door and explained the full process along with my diet and my lifestyle.  
I now seem to be getting to grips with everything and my levels are beginning to be at an acceptable level.  
We have met every two weeks to adjust my insulin and talk about my progress and I can't thank her enough for her efforts and working with me on my journey.  
I actually look forward to our meeting now on a Fridays and learning to look after myself in a much healthier way through her guidance.  
[Unsure about 'Staff skills']

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: equuleuswq89
title: We were seen immediately
body: Attended A&E last week when my partner had an allergic reaction. We were seen immediately and and were reviewed by trainee ANP Gemma Davidson. Gemma was brilliant! She was empathetic and kept us in the loop about his care. A lovely HCA gave us something to eat which was so kind. Thank you Gemma and colleagues!

author: Molly2013
title: Extremely personable and friendly
body:
I went for pre-op Q&A at the Vale of Leven hospital a few days ago. It was conducted by nurse Jo (didn't get her surname).  
She was extremely personable and friendly at put me at my ease immediately.  
Answered all my questions and calmed the anxiety that was building up to the day of procedure.  
She was a pleasure to talk to with as ready smile and calming nature.

readBy.name: Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

author: Richard02
title: Me, alcohol, my partner and my family
body:
Covid! Whilst I had a dependency on red wine, covid meant there was no reason to go into the office, you could hide from Teams at home - and my dependence got worse, and worse.  
My partner begged me to do something - I contacted ORB. Their initial route to treatement was to cut down - my mind doesn't work like that! They suggested, pour some away! Yeah I'd get to the end of the evening and go down the shop and buy more!  
2nd attempt with ORB and a "detox" was mentioned... game on!  
In December of my 2nd year with ORB, finally offered a detox - 20th December until 28th - yep Christmas! My partner wasn't sure - but I said maybe that's part of the test, do I / we really want this - I took it! Best decision ever!  
I am 10 weeks+ alcohol free! Moved house, and area and no longer in touch with ORB - unfortunately services in the new county said not much they can do - yet I am looking forward to 20th March 2023 - 3 months into my recovery!  
The staff from ORB and my fellow colleagues on teams weekly - I thank you for your help and support!

author: chamaeleonwe85
title: Waiting months on end for an appointment
body:
I had a scheduled smear test. I have had abnormal cells and treatment in the past so I am always on the ball with checkups. I had a letter 10 weeks later to say I had cell changes and needed a colposcopy at Ninewells. I then received a letter which gave me 3 days' notice of an appointment that I couldn't attend as I was away at the time.  
I phoned to reschedule and was given an appointment. I received a letter last week to say it was now moved to a month later. I have also had another letter to say my smear test is due.  
This is all very confusing and it will then be 9 months from smear to colposcopy if it is indeed done this time. When phoning the GP practice I was told I'm sure it's only mild changes. That put my worries to rest instantly ... not!  
You would think with all the recent campaigning advising people to get their smear tests that maybe the systems in place for those with abnormal results would not have them waiting months on end for an appointment, causing undue stress.

author: Lauran90
title: I have received excellent care
body: I cannot fault the level care and compassion the staff on this ward arr providing. I have received excellent care from all staff and students who are clearly overworked but who are tirelessly working to ensure everyone is safe and comfortable. An absolute credit to the NHS and I cannot thank them all enough.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

author: EEMCC
title: We were well cared for by the hospital at home team
body:
My husband saw his GP in late February 2023, and was diagnosed with a chest infection. He was referred to the Hospital at Home Team Fermanagh to be treated at home.  
He also has multiple myeloma and is frail so he was delighted to be able to be treated at home and not having to go to hospital. The nurses were with us very rapidly. They attended our home 3 times a day for 2 weeks where they gave him excellent care, and treated him with the same medication he would have got if he had to go into hospital.  
I was glad he could be treated at home because I knew everything that was going on, and I was able to ask questions and get information I might not have got if he was in a hospital environment. My husband was much more content too knowing he was in his own home.  
The nurses were very dedicated and professional and I want to say that they always kept me well informed of my husband's condition and how he was responding to treatment.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Paul 55
title: Time to reflect, contemplate, relax
body:
I requested referral to detox through CGL and due to a recently diagnosed heart condition it was determined that residential, medically supervised detox was the appropriate solution.  
The Dame Carol Black centre was proposed mid 2022.  
I had pretty much given up on it ever happening after many months of delay without any real explanation, but then out of the blue a place became available at two days notice. I couldn't attend due to jury service, but  
fortunately another place became available very quickly.  
On arrival the welcome was fantastic. The facilities are excellent and the staff are all exceptional. The whole ethos that pervades from top down and throughout is positive and surely has a positive impact upon clients.  
I have now come through detox without any problems or issues and thinking positively about the future without alcohol as a primary focus.  
I was apprehensive about spending 12 days with a bunch of strangers, but am surprised to have made some really strong friendships.  
This detox provides a time to reflect / contemplate and relax and constant daytime tv and shoot up action films constantly blaring is a real unwelcome distraction so perhaps some curfew or at least consensus would be helpful to many.  
It would also have been helpful to have the handbook sent in advance because it contains a lot of pre-visit information that I didn't see until I arrived (not sure whether CGL should have sent it, but no-one did).  
All in all though I would strongly recommend to anyone.

links.id: filled with hope for the future

author: JunoMac
title: Booking an appointment
body:
Trying to book and appointment to have a coil removed. I was given the number by my practice nurse. Tick.  
I tried the number over 2 days, but it rang out telling me there was no one to take my call - a very abrupt message, I must say.  
I tried the website and after reading that I could make an appointment for coil removal, I decided to give it a go. So I click on 'book an appointment' and hey guess what... NO option in the drop down for coil removal.  
Back to the phones!  
At least this time I ended up in a queue and spoke to an actual human, only to be told that I can't book an appointment and I'll have to call again on Monday (this is now Thursday) because that's when new appointments will be released. Say what?!  
If I was to book a hotel or holiday I would not have to call every day for vacancies - why can't I book far in advance if clinics are running? Just seems like the current system is making work for everyone - me and the poor people answering the phones. They must be feeling the public's wrath.  
Stop setting yourselves up to fail and do things intuitively, because that's what we get other places.

author: Mickal
title: I feel I have been repaired
body:
I have been referred to the Dame Carol Detox Service by CGL due to my excessive drinking of alcohol.  
It is my ninth day at this service and I am now feeling a lot better compared to when I first arrived. I feel I have been repaired.  
It is very nice and clean, the food is awesome. The medical help is 10 out of 10. Everything is perfect.  
I would recommend this place to others.  
I am polish, which is my first language. So communicating in English is a challenge for me. However, all the staff have been very helpful.

author: Elder
title: Sent to A&E
body: Mum was sent to A&E by her GP. We would like to thank all ok the staff for all the care she received everyone was helpful and caring fantastic work by all thankyou so much

author: Annu
title: Attending for a blood test
body: I came for my appointment 45 min late at the Antenatal ward, However, the maternity support worker took my blood and make me feel so comfortable. She did not make me realize that I'm late for my appointment she explains to me about the blood she is taking and how long it will take for the results. I would say she is just an amazing and very lovely person. York hospital is always great for me and my family. Each and every staff is always great and helpful to us.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: MikeK
title: I will be ever in their debt for the services they continue to provide!!
body:
I've had a long history of dental problems spanning the last 7-8 years, where I've gone from having perfect teeth to losing a few and suffering receding gums etc, all down to periodontitis and other possibly hereditary issues.  
Since being referred to the dental hospital by my own dentist, I have had numerous appointments, primarily with Professor Chadwick, and a lot of treatment with the wonderful Clinician Hazel.  
As a bit of background, I am EXTREMELY anxious about ANY dental work, but especially needles/injections. I would go as far to say it's a deep rooted phobia (no pun intended!).  
However, with the efforts of both of these amazing professionals, in particular Hazel, for her unlimited patience, and utterly empathetic and reassuring nature and actions, I have managed to undergo procedures I would never have dreamed of and have stabilized my dental condition to a point where I am no longer in excruciating pain!!  
Of course there are the many other staff and students whom I've had assist and help with treatment, and I cannot stress enough just how absolutely incomparable, irreplaceable and priceless these people are.  
It gives me great pride knowing they're all in my home town, and working so hard on behalf of our NHS to provide care of the utmost highest standards. I will be ever in their debt for the services they continue to provide!!

author: Snowy71
title: The care I received was superb
body: A shout out to Ulster ED. Care I received today was superb. Dr Sharma, SNA Alyson and Amanda. You guys are a credit to the service and to yourselves. Thank you so much. ‚ù§Ô∏è

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Christine75
title: I was pleased to have their reassurance and advice
body:
After breaking my ankle and having my leg in a cast for three weeks, I had a visit from Physios to check things over and to help improve my mobility.  
I was given some exercises to do to help my lower back and legs in preparation for the cast coming off in two weeks time.  
I was pleased to have their reassurance and advice and enjoyed their cheerful visit

author: Baggies19336
title: Outpatient appointment at the Endoscopy unit
body: I attended the Endoscopy Unit and the care that I received from every member of staff I encountered was superb, very caring, informative, understanding, friendly, treated with dignity and apologised for the unexpected delay, as a colleague working in the Trust it's very reassuring that this care whilst attending the unit is made aware to them how thankful I was for the way I was treated.

author: Ashxk77
title: Discussed everything in detail
body: I spoke to the staff nurse Jordan is A&E who could not have made us feel anymore comfortable. Discussed everything in detail and kept us up to date routinely , best nurse I‚Äôve ever encountered.

author: Sasha04
title: Everyone has been so kind
body:
Upon my arrival to the Dame Carol Detox Service, as a nervous person, I automatically felt very welcomed, which was nice as I suffer with anxiety.  
I have had a right laugh with the best kind of people. Everyone has been so kind. They have comfortable beds. The staff check on you every half an hour to check you are okay; they actually generally care for you, it's not just a job to the staff.  
I feel really lucky to have been given a place here to stay to help me detox from alcohol.  
For the first time, people actually believed in me and had faith in me. As the days progressed, even the shyest of people gained confidence and engaged with others in a group setting.  
I have made some really good friends who I will stay in contact with because they understand your journey.

author: Nikita817
title: Feel good about moving forward
body:
Had a really supported meeting about my reduction  
I love Evie my support worker  
Caroline was great with support and my reduction plan  
Didn't feel rushed and feel good about moving forward

author: Marcia7
title: Telephone triage appt system- very unsafe in mental health

author: warmfy49
title: Thank you for giving us our daughter back
body:
When our teenage daughter attempted suicide we felt our world collapse.  
We felt heartbroken, helpless, hopeless and overwhelmed.  
The CAMHS Intensive Treatment Team (CITT) service were on board immediately on discharge. The service they provide to the young person and their family is second to none.  
The journey to our daughters ongoing recovery has been a rollercoaster and we could not have coped without them .  
They never gave up on her or us.  
They made the darkest of times bearable and we can't thank them enough for their professionalism and compassion.  
Evan and James we thank you for giving us our daughter back.

author: Simi
title: I was so very well looked after
body:
I was very poorly with colon cancer, it was quickly diagnosed at Northampton General Hospital Colonoscopy Unit, who were very kind.  
I was operated on Dr Ihedioha and his superb operating theatre team and then taken to Althorpe Ward to recover. I was there for 6 days and so very well looked after by all the doctors and nurses, and all the other staff on Althorpe Ward.  
I would like to thank ALL the staff at NGH that cared for me during my stay. I‚Äôm now living a full normal life, back home with all my family and back at my job after 6 weeks thanks to them. Thanks you so much.

author: humanitiesmw34
title: Hotel and travel expenses could have been avoided
body:
Around the end of December, I was called by the Grampian Waiting List Clinic confirming I was on the waiting list for cataract surgery.  
I confirmed that I was waiting and the member of staff proceeded to tell me my options regarding where I might be seen. They offered me Aberdeen or Glasgow waiting lists. I asked how the assessment process went and they explained I would be invited for an assessment, go home, then back another day for surgery. I then said I was not willing to travel to Glasgow on 2 separate occasions. They then said that they had not explained themselves correctly and said if I choose to go on the Glasgow waiting list I would be assessed and operated on the same day. They stated that the waiting list is much longer for Aberdeen than Glasgow  
After that explanation, I agreed to go to Glasgow, but found out when my pre-assessment forms came through the post, that what I had been told was incorrect.  
Although the accommodation provided in Glasgow was excellent, as was the care I received, had I been correctly informed, I would have saved myself time and stress, and just gone to Aberdeen. This process of outsourcing clinics is a good compromise, one I do support, but Grampian Health Board has picked up the tab for hotel accommodation and travel expenses which could have been avoided.  
When I called Grampian Waiting List Clinic, after I received the pre-assessment forms and appointment date for Glasgow. I spoke with a lovely member of staff. When I explained my story (prior to going to Glasgow) they stated that this has been happening quite a lot. They offered to put me on the Aberdeen list but could not tell me how long the list was or where I would be on that list, so I accepted to Glasgow appointment.  
With having 2 cataracts to remove, this will now involve another 2 trips to Glasgow in the near future.  
I am highlighting this to ensure that the staff in the Waiting List Clinic, get their story correct before organising any more appointments.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Patpm39
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They are angels sent from above
body: The district nurses have been a great help to me over the past few months. They were attending to administer medication and I happened to ask about something else that had been troubling me. In no time, the issue was treated and resolved. It had been troubling me for a few weeks and I only wish I had mentioned it sooner. They are angels sent from above. Thank you.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: nuthatchde74
title: Lovely staff at Outpatient visit
body:
I visited Outpatient Department A yesterday for an appointment. Firstly I was greeted by lovely cheery staff at the reception desk (Andrew).  
Mr Stirling, was the member of staff to see my for the tests I was to have. Although I‚Äôm very used to a hospital setting it can always be a bit daunting attending for an appointment and undergoing test you‚Äôve not had before.  
Mr Stirling professional and personable. He explained all the tests fully as we went along and I felt very comfortable throughout.

author: Smudger69
title: Poor experience at Clinical Assessment Unit
body:
I was referred by GP to the above with serious sepsis due to an infection and was told that I would be put on IV antibiotics when I get there. I arrived and the staff member at the desk didn‚Äôt have a clue - first of all they got my name wrong then I was told to sit in the patient area chairs and my wife wasn‚Äôt allowed to wait, although there were other families with their family with them.  
I sat in the seat for over two hours with no IV antibiotics, I eventually asked at the desk what was happening and again they didn‚Äôt have a clue. I wait for another two to three hours and asked a nurse at the desk what was happening and my paperwork couldn‚Äôt be found.  
I was then taken for my obs without being triaged. I gave blood and when the results came back I was told that my inflammatory markers were raised a bit. I also had an ecg to be told it was ok and I could go home. I was still feeling unwell and went to my GP today, they asked if I got IV antibiotics to which I said no. I was also told that my inflammatory markers were over 100 when they should be between 0-5 and my ecg heart rate was high. I am always full of praise for the NHS where it is due but this time I and my family have been let down.

author: March 8/3/23
title: The presentation was so informative
body:
I attended the Hip replacement education session with my mum in preparation for her upcoming hip replacement. The physio and OT's presentation was so informative and we left feeling much more at ease about her pending surgery. They were both very friendly.  
We then attended the pre op assessment clinic with a lovely staff nurse and a student nurse. Again an efficient, informative clinic carried out by two friendly nurses. Well done CAH üëè

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A great hospital experience
body:
I came in Tuesday after I had a bad fall at home. I was then admitted to the rehabilitation ward. The staff have all been amazing. I am being treated so well. The nurses go over and above to look after everyone. They are run off their feet but still do their best to see to each and every patient‚Äôs needs.  
I am sleeping very well. The bed is lovely and comfy.  
The food seems quite nice. I am not a big eater so it would take very little to fill me. The portion sizes are good and sufficient.  
I think the hospital is great and I have no faults at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Pauline234
title: Hand therapy
body:
Following a Serious Road Traffic Accident (RTA) my husband had sustained serious injuries which required extensive ongoing physio on his hand/wrist.  
Can I just say the support we have received from Occupational therapist Linda has been incredible. Linda is so supportive and professional. She has worked so closely with my husband and has made a real difference to his recovery.  
Linda gets to know her patients and understands how important this therapy is to there daily living.  
As a family we can never thank Linda and the fracture team at the Royal enough.  
Thank you all for your ongoing support.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: festivityhg38
title: Very good experience
body: Everything explained very carefully and staff were so friendly and helpful. All my questions were answered and explained in detail. Very good experience at a stressful time.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Enigma59
title: Very professional, clear, structured, and organised
body:
My mother was visited by the representative (Lesley) from Physio at Home at her care home. Lesley had previously made the appointment and turned up at the appointed time. She had asked facility members to be present in order to provide feedback with regard to my mother's mobility, and specifically in connection with the matter of stair climbing.  
The session was completed with my mother completing a set of practical exercises. Lesley then conducted an examination of my mother's zimmer frame and completed some maintenance work (replacing the rubber end caps).  
She then discussed what was going to happen next (external walking) and noted that she would confirm the next appointment shortly.  
Very professional, clear, structured, and organised.

author: MarionJK
title: Hip biopsy
body:
Hip biopsy  
Very well looked after

author: coinbg83
title: Made a difficult experience bearable!
body: I was in Ward 33 (formerly 36) for two days this week undergoing a planned gynaecology operation. The care I received from all the staff was professional, respectful and kind. It made a difficult experience bearable!

author: magpiedg85
title: Haematology ward
body:
I was a patient in haematology for 3 weeks and I was struggling with the isolation, but my nurse Eimear picked up my spirits and helped me get through those tough few weeks and I couldn‚Äôt thank her enough!  
The entire team are absolutely amazing , angels!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great patience and understanding from the nurse
body: Went for a cervical screening test today - something I've avoided for too long. The nurse was wonderful, listening to me, asking how she could help make things easier and showing no judgment at all, just kindness and encouragement. She was amazing - thank you.

author: cygnuscd76
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very accommodating staff
body:
I came up to ED after being referred by my doctor last Friday. I was triaged very quickly and had bloods done, however it was a long wait on getting scans done. The staff in ED were very good.  
Since moving up to Stroke/rehab it has been wonderful. The staff are so accommodating. They moved me in to a separate room as the noise and lights on the main ward where hurting my head. The nurses very kindly moved me into a side room. They are so good. The staffing team on Stroke/rehab are fantastic. Every single one has a great personality. They are very kind and caring.  
I haven‚Äôt been eating much as I really didn‚Äôt have an appetite, but today I had some mince and potatoes and it was very nice.  
I am very happy with the care and hospitality. I don‚Äôt know how anyone could complain about staff in Daisy Hill when the staff do their very best to look after you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Minme99
title: Absolutely exceptional care and attentiveness
body:
My husband had been unwell, the doctor had forwarded him on to the acute care team as he would not have been fit for a trip to the emergency room  
The team that came out to my husband have been more than helpful. Absolutely exceptional care and attentiveness have been given at the highest level. I would recommend this service to anyone who needs it! Thank you again to the acute care at home team.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Lovely staff, good practice in general in my‚Ä¶
body: Really helpful staff, especially receptionist staff in my experience. Happy to go the extra mile to help with anything they can.

author: Sue960
title: Excellent service
body:
I felt very nervous and anxious when I was referred to breast clinic under 2 week wait. Had an appointment within 2 weeks of seeing my GP.  
On my appointment day I was treated with sensitivity and respect by everyone within the unit. The reception team were helpful, the lady making free hot drinks, the nurses and radiographers were lovely.  
The star of the show was Dr Michael, he was so kind, caring and informative. A great negative result for me. I felt so relieved and reassured, and all within 2 hours, excellent service. If you‚Äôre referred, rest assured you‚Äôll be well cared for.

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The nurses are very competent at their job
body:
I have been in hospital since last Friday. It has been a long stay but the staff have made it very pleasant. Everyone has been lovely on female surgical. The nurses are very competent at their job. I have been treated so well by everyone. They are extremely attentive to patients. The nurses and health care assistants are very reliable.  
The ward is lovely and clean. It‚Äôs very well maintained by all the cleaning staff.  
I must say the food is good, it‚Äôs very filling. There is a great selection of choice on the menu.  
I have not one thing to fault. But I am looking forward to getting home.  
I am very satisfied

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very hard working, very professional and‚Ä¶
body: The reception and triage service is very efficient. The staff are exceptional. It was a very busy time for them but they kept things moving, especially for those needing urgent attention. Unfortunately, I had to wait but I really appreciate the time spent with me. Staff all excellent and cannot be faulted.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Friendly reception and really good doctors who listen and explain what‚Äôs wrong and make sure you understand what the next steps are.

title: Great practice
body:
The reception staff are pleasant, helpful, polite and accommodating
 The medical staff give one time to  put forward one‚Äôs feelings/ailments and are extremely good at analysing one‚Äôs concerns and forwarding  the patient to the correct medical department at hospital or suitable medical establishment.

author: pelicanjq67
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: All the staff are so lovely
body:
I came up to ED on Monday evening. I was moved up to Female Surgical on Tuesday. I had quite a long wait in ED.  
Since coming up to the ward, it has been very good. All the staff are so lovely. The nurses are so helpful. The doctors are round a couple of times a day. There is a nurse in particular who is very good, her name is Akshara. She is so good. I give her an awful fright when I fainted yesterday but she was so helpful.  
The bed is very comfortable. I would have back problems so the support in the bed is rather good.  
The ward is clean. It is well run.  
I have been very happy with everything on female surgical.  
My only complaint would be the waiting times in ED, however I do understand why they are so busy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Snowman2023
title: Treatment and rehab of multiple fractures of my pelvis
body: I was out for a leisure cycle and fell heavily onto my right side when my back wheel scidded part way round a roundabout. I felt shocked and in pain but very well cared for both by passers by and by the ambulance crew

title: Caring doctors & lovely receptionists
body: I have transferred here from East London and an so impressed. The doctors are very thorough so very unlike my old surgery. I'm menopausal and have been treated so well and sympathetically. I also have a stammer and the reception staff are always patient

title: Caring and respectful
body: Drs always call back when I have needed a telephone consultation they are respectful helpful and listen to me. I have a son with autism he has always been treated very well they are patient with him , he is also called up for an annual check up regularly

title: So disappointed in my experience here
body: I'm sorry to have to leave a review like this but I think its important that members of the public have a fair review.  I'm so disappointed with how long it has took in getting any kind of treatment. Since I was referred in August last year I've got to step two and had a consultation and telephone call from the person who did my consultation around October/Nov I believe was the last time I heard from them. It takes forever for them to answer your call when I've witnessed two receptionists taking there time to answer calls as they get up and disappear forever.  I'm waiting to see the consultant to discus treatment and a referral for some kind of surgery as I've lived in constant pain for 23 years. I've had to constantly chase things up which isn't fair.  I appreciate that they are swamped with patients but polite friendly staff wouldn't be a bad idea?? Sorry to be so negative   but I speak from experiencing this first hand.

title: Top notch
body:
top notch
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ

Rated 5 stars out of 5

by soph - Posted on 09 March 2023

From an ECG and bloods to a consultation with my GP (who, incidentally is second to none), medication and a referral, the whole process was seamless. Mix in masses of knowledge, explanation of processes and oodles of kindness and you've got perfection. Thank you to my GP and the lovely nurses and staff.

Visited March 2023

author: cetusmb79
title: Supported us all through an extremely difficult time
body:
My Gran had been cared for in AAU for over a week.  
During such a sensitive an upsetting time, Staff were friendly and compassionate towards both my Gran, my family and I.  
In particular I would like to thank Lisah (agency nurse), Cat, Rosie, Casey, Claire, Karen, Lovely and Julie.  
We were also cared for by Morven, palliative care nurse. We as a family cannot thank her enough for the care she offered us. She took time get to know us and the knitted hearts she gave to my Gran and us was extremely kind and has offered us much comfort in this upsetting time. She listened to our concerns and offered reassurance, guidance and support.  
Morven showed my gran such kindness and compassion also and directed her attention straight to her when situations changed. We cannot thank Morven enough and she will truly not be forgotten.  
Thank you again to the staff in AAU for supporting us all through an extremely difficult time.

title: Very impressive experience
body:
Wonderful appointment with gaenocologist
She was senditive, empathetic and inspired confidence. Two nurses present for examination were helpful, understanding and a credit to the hospital.

title: Worse experience
body: Worse experience of my life 15 hrs sitting in waiting area being a cancer patient no beds available seen by three Drs each one saying different thing and after 15 hrs sent home without any pain killer or medicne saying that it is cancer related ur cancer department will contact u seriously this is how u treat a 75 year old cancer patient plz have some mercy on patients

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: equuleuskx79
title: Very helpful and efficient
body: The service I received was excellent. It was very helpful and efficient-I was seen on time and the nurse was very helpful.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cw18
title: My daughter's stay on the ward
body: My daughter callie was admitted for day surgery on the 9th of March 2023 to ward 1ab we stayed overnight and my goodness the love care encouragement and enthusiasm of the staff were outstanding these nurses and surgeons were absolutely amazing and myself and my daughter would like to thank each and every one of them for their awesomeness.

author: Hapck99
title: Pelvic physiotherapy
body:
Amazing service, fantastic treatment from Denise, made me feel at ease and taught me so much about my pelvic health in which i did not know being in my late 30s how did i not know this information?  
Was referred after a bad tear during childbirth in which i was seen very quickly demonstrating how good the service is running. I come away from each appointment feeling confident and happy and i wish every woman can have access to this service before and after childbirth as it is unacceptable as a woman to not know about my own anatomy and how to properly look after my muscles.  
Moving forward for the future in my opinion there needs to be more information out there it should be routinely taught to woman for example classes for all woman not just for postnatal patients so we can be educated and be able to ask for advice i am sure this would mean more funding for these services however it is much needed in this day and age as woman we should not have to put up with pelvic problems and just have to accept that its a ‚Äúwoman thing‚Äù.

author: Johxh33
title: Fantastic care, brilliant service
body:
Got a cancellation appointment at Stracathro for surgery to correct a inguinal hernia, although it meant arranging transport I was very pleased about this as I had been told initially it would be at least 18 to 24 months before I would be seen now that I was officially on the waiting list after waiting over a year to be seen.  
Fantastic care from all at Stracathro, thank you to everyone and a special thanks to Ria the student nurse for looking after me so well and thank you to Dr McKracken for arranging everything, brilliant service from the NHS

author: PrincessPinky
title: Fantastic staff taking care of our kids
body:
Toddler fell and hurt her pinky finger, it was a mess of bruises and swelling which had me concerned that there may be a fracture. Made contact with GP reception who sign posted us to NHS24. After a short wait we were given an appointment with RHCYP minor injuries.  
From the moment we arrived on site, staff were wonderful. As I was unfamiliar with the new sick kids building, I asked a passing nurse for the best route and he was kind enough to walk us there. The receptionist was helpful and friendly.  
Understandably, the department was very busy but the triage nurse got to Toddler within a half hour of our appointment time. It took about 45 minutes to then to see the doctor, who checked from elbow to the tips of Toddler's fingers for injuries. She was friendly and kind to Toddler, who was a little unsure and afraid of the unfamiliar examination room. Thankfully there were no breaks or fractures, but the doctor advised taping Toddler's pinky and ring fingers to protect the injured pinky. A nurse demonstrated and walked me through taping the fingers then provided us with the tape and guaze we would need for the next few days.Fantastic staff taking care of our kids, and doing so in a short time frame. Our short wait time was due to a number of higher priority injuries presenting around the same time that we arrived and we were comfortable enough in the waiting room surrounded by toys, a colouring station and kids TV shows.Toddler left with taped fingers, a smile and a monkey teddy.

author: circinusrp67
title: Very helpful and supportive
body: Health visitor Jane has been very helpful and supportive and although (almost) everyone has a negative story about a health visitor, so far this hasn‚Äôt been the case with me!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Caz87
title: The care was 10/10
body:
Today I brought my 80 year old grandad in as he‚Äôd fallen at the home he lives in and they were worried he‚Äôd hurt his arm. The home called the frailty team first and let them know I would be bringing him in to be assessed. On arrival, they welcomed us in the unit. Such wonderful friendly staff and made grandad feel at ease, soon as we were in they offered him a drink and biscuit.  
Once they gave him a cubicle, they came in to discuss why he was there and what they are going to carry out, constantly talking to grandad and reassuring him, as he‚Äôs has dementia can get very confused. The whole experience at the frailty unit was amazing, all the staff were just so lovely patient and caring towards grandad. I Just wanted to leave a review and recognise the care was 10/10 and would like to thank each staff member who was involved in grandads care today.  
Big thanks to all at the frailty team üôåüèªüôåüèª

author: MisterC
title: Physio to injured shoulder
body:
My shoulder and arm had been very painful for about 3 years from unknown causes. After months of pain and lack of sleep it was suggested I may have Polymyalgea, so was given a dose of steroids.  
When we moved home the new doctor in Langholm picked up on this and examined me. The doctor diagnosed a rotator cuff injury and referred me to X-ray and was given a shoulder steroid which helped. Came off the tablet steroids and took tramadol instead.  
Was referred to physio. At Lockerbie I was seen by Sinead who examined me, and after diagnosis gave me some tension exercises which gradually, over 4 months, relieved the pain and helped strengthen the muscles so I can use my right arm again. It‚Äôs still ongoing, but I can sit and lay down without severe discomfort.

title: Once again, excellent care!
body: Used online portal to book an appointment for pain yesterday. I received a phone call from a lovely receptionist within 15minutes, with an face to face appointment 40 minutes later. The Dr was thorough and after discussing my options, got me an appointment with the surgical assessment unit at Wythenshawe hospital. The result was I was back home after a few hours in my own bed recovering, after a ct scan, bloods and antibiotics for an infection in my kidney. A and E was experiencing long waits at the time and I considered myself so fortunate to have such skilled and responsive medical practice. It would've been a much different scenario at my previous GP practice. Feel so much better today, thank u Cornishway.

author: thubanjf58
title: Made a horrible time for us much easier
body:
Just wanted to say how amazing all of the staff were at the Royal Aberdeen Children's Hospital, the assessment unit and the medical ward.  
Our little girl was really unwell, they acted really quickly when we came in, and everyone caring for her were so lovely. We stayed in for 2 nights and saw a lot of different nurses/doctors, they made a horrible time for us much easier, they couldn‚Äôt have been better.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: empathytw56
title: Everybody was just 100%
body: I have been to the New Victoria Hospital today in Glasgow, I was in their eye clinic for an operation done on my eye lids, so it was a day surgery in the eye clinic, and it went very well, (as far as I know!) I have got a swollen face but every thing went well, the nursing staff and the staff in the operating theatre were great, everything was absolutely first class. That‚Äôs why I wanted to share this feedback via Care Opinion, because it was so good I thought I must let you know! Everybody was just 100%, it‚Äôs great to see people doing their jobs so well.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Kay172
title: I experienced kindness & courtesy from the minute I walked into the department
body:
Having fallen over a few days ago I attended A&E at Ayr Hospital. On arrival the department waiting area was very busy & 4 waiting ambulances were outside with patients waiting to be admitted to the department. Some people complained about the wait time & I witnessed one person be particularly rude to the reception staff.  
Yes, it was very busy & staff were obviously under pressure. However, I experienced kindness & courtesy from the minute I walked into the department. Reception staff, triage nurse, ANP, nursing assistant & radiology staff were all friendly & I did not feel like a burden to anyone.  
Wendy, the ANP who treated me, was so wonderful. In less than 3 hours I was triaged, assessed, x-rayed, re-assessed, plaster cast applied, painkillers given & left with a follow-up appointment in 1 week.  
We are so quick to complain when things go wrong that I thought it only fair to give praise & thanks where it is due. Thank you, NHS Ayrshire & Arran.

author: LoveOpera
title: Sigmoidoscopy
body: Not the most enjoyable  experience and at times very uncomfortable.  The staff, however,  were brilliant. Sympathetic, understanding and of course professional. Particular thanks to the student nurse who talked to me throughout the procedure.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: lyraph36
title: First group session
body:
Great service that is very accessible. The support team are all friendly and caring people and are always easy to contact.  
Looking forward to progressing with my recovery.

author: volanszr78
title: The clinic is very polite and nice
body: I got an injection. They made me feel comfortable.

author: LMoody
title: Fantastic Service
body:
Yesterday my son was sent into GRI AAU by his GP due to ongoing sinus infection. It was clearly a worrying time being asked to attend hospital there and then. The care he received was excellent. He was very thoroughly checked over including a CT scan which was reported to us within an hour of having the scan. The staff were all so friendly and helpful, especially the Dr who dealt with him (apologies I don‚Äôt know his name). They all put us at ease, explained everything, gave an opportunity for questions and listened to what we had to say.  
We were there for a number of hours and heard lots of people moaning about the waiting, but the staff were very good throughout our journey of explaining where there might be a wait - I think if you expect it, it is always easier to deal with. Given the treatment we received I think that waiting a little is a small price to pay.  
To be so thoroughly checked out, we do have an amazing NHS when it works well, and I felt it worked really well yesterday. It was clearly a department that worked really well together, like a well oiled machine! We were so grateful for the service we received. Thanks to a great team.

author: Sala13
title: Incredibly supportive and a very good listener
body:
In September last year I was offered the opportunity to have a referral to the well-being service from my GP. I was desperate to stop smoking due to several health issues that were being made worse by it, and I had made several unsuccessful attempts in the past. The referral was picked up quickly and before I knew it I had been sent information through the post and had an initial meeting with my advisor Lorna.  
From the outset she was incredibly supportive and a very good listener, we talked through all of the issues I'd had in the past, and put together a plan for how we were going to tackle it and what could possibly help or hinder my progress. She covered every angle and always addressed tasks that needed doing in a timely manner, for example liaising with my GP to arrange prescriptions.  
Unfortunately during the time we were working through the plan I experienced a significant period of high stress. This was all going on alongside having just moved to the area. It was not an easy time and Lorna was so very kind and compassionate towards me and my family, even though I had a small relapse she was never judgemental, she listened with empathy and kept me accountable for my actions without pushing me too hard. I was able to start again and continue on the plan we had agreed.  
We had regular telephone meetings. During each of our meetings we discussed different things that were working for me and events that might cause me problems and we came up with a plan. Lorna is full of creative ideas and has a wealth of knowledge about all sorts of things. She directed me to podcasts, websites, exercise classes the list goes on.  
I have just been discharged from the service- I'm currently 128 days clear of smoking. I never thought I could achieve this, and I will never go backwards. (the NHS app keeps me accountable daily).  
I have seen a significant improvement in my health issues and there is no way I could have reached this point without the help of my advisor Lorna, and I will always be grateful to her and the Well-being service for that, as well as my GP for the initial referral.

author: intensityse86
title: Very professional and reassuring
body: I attended ARI outpatient ultrasound. Radiographer Ashley and Radiologist Jose made me feel very comfortable during the scan. They were both very professional and very reassuring. I am completely confident everything is fine after their assessment.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership
